title: [Large-Scale] High-Strength Aluminum-Lithium Alloy Design: A Machine Learning-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic materials engineering and understanding of machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: A blended learning class combining theory and practice in a BYOD environment, focusing on systematically understanding alloy design processes and cultivating predictive capabilities using machine learning models

learning_goals: Learners can compare the predictive performance differences between RBF and BP neural network models using quantitative metrics (RÂ², RMSE, MAE).
Learners can build a machine learning model to predict tensile strength and yield strength using aluminum-lithium alloy composition as input variables.
Through project outcomes, learners can propose a new alloy design that improves strength by 10% or more compared to existing alloys.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
